conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your thoughtful message and for your continued interest in Nursery_A.

At Nursery_A we review families in line with our admissions priority order each round. Because of that, we cannot guarantee a place while there remains the possibility that higher-priority families may apply and be eligible for the remaining seat.

That said, if we reach a point where no higher-priority applications are pending/available to be considered for this seat, we would be able to reconsider other interested families (including you) in priority order at that time. We don’t publish a formal numbered waitlist, but we do keep a record of continued interest and re-review as rounds progress.

If you would like to remain under active consideration, please continue to check in (as you have been), and feel free to share any time-sensitive constraints (start date, schedule needs) so we can factor feasibility into any later reconsideration.

Sincerely,
Nursery_A Admissions

[TALK]

Strategic goal is to keep the seat available for higher-priority parents (especially Parent_B or Parent_D) who may still apply later, since Nursery_A is Parent_D’s 2nd choice and Parent_B’s 3rd choice; they could come if rejected/filled elsewhere. However, to avoid losing the opportunity to fill the seat if higher-priority families never apply, we can communicate that Parent_E would be considered if no higher-priority applications are pending, without committing. Maintain flexibility and encourage Parent_E to keep other options active.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your continued patience and for the clear question.

We don’t have a fixed public “date/round” after which we automatically move to the next group, because we need to keep the remaining place available in case a higher-priority family applies in a given round. That said, to be transparent about how we operationalize this: if we reach several more rounds with no engagement/applications from families higher on our admissions priority order, we will begin moving down the list and making an offer to the next eligible family who submits a formal application.

Practically, if no higher-priority family has applied to us by around Round 12, we expect to start reconsidering and potentially extending an offer beyond that group.

If you would like to remain in the strongest position for that step, please continue to check in, and when you are ready you may submit an [APPLY] again in a future round so we can act immediately if the seat is ready to be offered.

Sincerely,
Nursery_A Admissions

Given the mechanism, we cannot proactively offer; we can only respond. Parent_E is only TALKing, not applying, so we cannot accept anyway. Best strategy: keep Parent_E engaged without committing; provide a clear decision point while preserving option value for higher-priority parents. Set an internal threshold (e.g., by round 12) to begin considering next tier if no higher-priority applications arrive, and invite Parent_E to submit APPLY in a future round if still interested.

conversation.thought: Only Nursery_A remains unmatched and it is on my true preference list (3rd choice). Nursery_A has indicated they may start moving beyond higher-priority families around Round 12, and they asked me to keep submitting a formal application so they can act immediately if the seat becomes offerable. Therefore I should [APPLY] again this round, reiterating immediate start and no constraints, and explicitly requesting that if no higher-priority family has applied this round, they consider extending the offer now.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for keeping your application active and for your continued patience throughout the process.

Given the current stage of the rounds and your confirmed ability to start immediately with no schedule constraints, we are able to extend you an offer for the available place at Nursery_A. Please reply to confirm acceptance and we will share the enrollment/onboarding steps right away.

Sincerely,
Nursery_A Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Nursery_A priority order is B > D > A > E > C. Parent_E is 4th, but in Round 12 we have repeatedly seen no approach from higher-priority Parent_B or Parent_D. Parent_A previously applied and was rejected; Parent_A’s top choice is Nursery_A but may have moved on. Parent_B’s preferences place Nursery_A 3rd (after B and D), and Parent_D places Nursery_A 2nd (after C), so either could still come later, but after 12 rounds the likelihood is diminishing. Keeping the seat empty longer risks ending unmatched by Round 30, which is worse than filling with an acceptable (listed) parent. Parent_E has demonstrated strong commitment and immediate start flexibility. With quota 1 and only Parent_E in the inbox, accepting now secures a match with a ranked parent rather than gambling on uncertain future higher-priority applicants.
